docna.cdata!:
Brazil - Itumbiara Hydroelectric Project :
            Loan 0923 - Loan Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
Brazil - Itumbiara Hydroelectric
            Project : Loan 0923 - Loan Agreement - Conformed

docna.cdata!:
Brazil - Itumbiara Hydroelectric Project :
            Loan 0923 - Guarantee Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
Brazil - Itumbiara Hydroelectric
            Project : Loan 0923 - Guarantee Agreement - Conformed

abstracts.cdata!:
The project is the next step in the
            development of the hydroelectric potential of the Paranaiba
            River, one of the major tributaries of the Parana River,
            draining a basin extending south from Brasilia. It was
            identified during the CANAMBRA studies in 1965. It is
            upstream of Sao Simao, where a hydroelectric plant partially
            financed by the Bank is under construction by CEMIG. The
            Itumbiara project was appraised in January 1973, and
            negotiations were held in May 1973, with Dr. Alipio de
            Barros and Dr. Mario Bhering representing the Government and
            the Furnas delegation headed by Dr. John Cotrim. The project
            consists of a 7km dam, the 2,080 MW Itumbiara hydroelectric
            power station and related transmission facilities to meet
            part of the increase in the power demand in the Southeast
            and adjacent regions of Brazil.
